comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/36673557/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/36673557)

Coverage decreased (-0.03%) to 81.575% when pulling **af2a2617a2dd2b579cbe9af36ac3fea8e96eb724 on 998-templates** into **824257038ee32cebc95bfecae9bf78f758abe1df on alma**.

Resolved by:
1. updating the alma index to only create / clean up one tempfile at a time (#1014)
2. attaching a larger drive at `/data` on the staging box (the same way we will setup prod)

Also created #1016 as a follow-up to ensure the contents of `/data` don't unexpectedly grow out of control.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/36674727/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/36674727)

pulfalight.title: Search results are not being listed by relevancy

comments.body:
I spent a ridiculously long time trying to boost items which had collections that exactly matched the given query and was not successful. Instead, for now, I think I'm going to adjust the "mm" parameter to limit the number of results that get returned and return to this at some other time.

Relevant things I tried:

http://robotlibrarian.billdueber.com/2012/03/using-localparams-in-solr-sst-2/
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20217686/multiple-boost-queries-in-solr/20345687#20345687

pulfalight.title: Keyword search for name in direct order yields too many results

comments.body: I set minimum must match to 75%, which means 75% of the query has to appear for an item to show up in results. I can make that number higher for more restricted results (100% means every word needs to show up), but I think we should fiddle with that later.

pulfalight.title: Auto-suggest search suggestions should be relevant to the field that is being searched

comments.body: I think @jrgriffiniii added this to the WCAG epic, but probably by accident as it's not an accessibility thing. I will remove this from the epic. I don't think it needs to be prioritized.

pulfalight.title: Suggest a correction icon needs alt text
Search results when a name is selected from the Names facet are confusing/duplicative

comments.body:
@faithc This is also interesting. Things are listed twice because only collections have indexed names, there aren't any components with "Paz, Octavio, 1914-1998". Would you expect search results to show every component in every collection that has that name?

I can propagate the names from collections to components for discovery purposes, if necessary.

I'm not sure what the behavior should be exactly, but the duplication seems odd. 

Also, agent records will now also be indexed as well, correct? Should agent records be the only names that are indexed/accessed via this facet? Other names that don't have agent records will still be discoverable via a general keyword search, correct? Does that make sense?
I guess a general question is how will agent records be integrated and discoverable on the site?

pulfalight.title: Bioghist notes associated with agent records should display with agents and in finding aids

comments.body: Sorry, @tpendragon, why is this blocked? Does this have to do with waiting for ASpace data?
Might this also be doable for pulfa 2.0 while it's still in use? if not, that's ok since it will only be an issue for a relatively small period of time.

It's just blocked because it has a dependency. We have to update our aspace plugin to embed agent bioghists at the component level. We're not waiting on anyone, there's just another ticket to do first.
Gotcha. Thanks for explaining. :)

comments.body: https://github.com/pulibrary/archivesspace-development/tree/main/data-prep/XML_prep/aspace2pulfa

* Storage note doesn't display: output is missing `physloc/@id`
* Languages look funky if more than one: output has text() AND `@langcode`

https://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/WC064/c0017 the text displays under acquisition notes or under the description note if there is no `acqinfo`.
I mean, it's minor, but something I noticed and a bit confusing.
- For WC064, the collection tabs aren't working; they just bring one back to the site's homepage.
Thanks!
@faithc What do you mean by "collection tabs"?
Sorry, the `descgrp`s: Description, Collection History, Access and Use, etc.
Oh--those display for me. Perhaps the tree was still loading when you tried it?
Huh, perhaps. That EAD seems to be loading even slower than usual (and it's usually fairly slow). ha

pulfalight.title: Can't access Request Cart element via keyboard-only navigation
Sets focus on request cart, when opened
Submission of "Ask A Question" results in error
Info re: top 3 search results within collections

comments.body:
@faithc @ccleeton The site does a search with your query and then groups all the results by the collection they're in, displaying the other top 2 results from within that same collection.

So if my top result is "Bananas" and my second result is "Apples", my first collection will be Bananas' collection and two other matching results from that collection, and the second collection will be Apples' collection, with two other matching results from that collection (assuming they're different collections.)

Most of this is handled by Solr, but the gist of it is if we want a certain collection to appear first we have to do that by adjusting the relevancy ranking of the components.

Make sense? Can we close this?
Gotcha. I'm ok with closing it.

pulfalight.title: Statement on Archival Language links

comments.body: @faithc I will add this link to every component, but that bar is reserved for "action" items. I will find a better place for it. Also, I don't see a "Help" page. Can you provide a link to the Statement? Is the intention to bring the user to another site when they click the button?

Thanks, Shaun. Yeah, this page/section needs some work. It's currently only discoverable via the home page in the Request Materials section:  https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/research_help. Assuming we want a persistent link at the top of the site too like in pulfa (maybe next to the request cart?) with text that reads something like Site Information, since the content will be more than just helpful tips and such. 

@ccleeton looping you in. We should probably review the content here. The AV materials note can be deleted for example since that's now on the website.

The AV links to the website which is what we had said would work incase we change anything related to the policy so I'd like to keep that.
The whole grouping of the help page needs alot of work. The FAQs could use a hyperlinks in alot of the sections. @faithc should we go back to our drafts in the drive and work from there?
Oh that's right re: AV, forgot it just links to the website now. I didn't even check (clearly). haha

Just looked at this doc https://docs.google.com/document/d/15gzcQT36NttEVjvxNcUEZ2iFdZhkhp4vkfngJ--MYxs/edit
Looks like none of the hyperlinks there are showing on the new site. I did add a few new ones though.

pulfalight.title: Add link to Ask us a Question for repository contact.
Collection-level dates display

comments.body: @faithc Looking at this now. The bulk date is definitely different from the old site, but I'm seeing duplicate dates in pulfa too. Do you know what the deal is there? https://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/C0062

Oh, I guess it's pulling the data from `unittitle` and `unitdate`? Guess I didn't notice the repetition in pulfa since the font is different for `unitdate`. Wondering if it should just display what's in `titleproper` to eliminate the redundancy? Not sure that the ASpace export looks like? Might be a question for @regineheberlein.

titleproper has no nested elements in ASpace--it's a string.

on pulfa, titleproper has one or several nested date elements with type attributes for the inclusive and bulk dates. https://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/C0062 is what we've always had. It displays the string value of titleproper (including the string value of the nested date), and after that, the values of the `@type` ("bulk" and "inclusive") respectively in smaller gray font.

```
<titleproper>
Booth Tarkington Papers,
<date normal="1812/1956" type="inclusive">1812-1956</date>
(bulk
<date normal="1899/1946" type="bulk">1899-1946</date>
): Finding Aid
</titleproper>
```

This is true, but the constituent parts are in aspace:
```
<titleproper>Noël Riley Fitch Papers, 1858-2012 (bulk 1965-1995): Finding Aid <num>C0841</num></titleproper>
```
```
    <unittitle>Noël Riley Fitch Papers</unittitle>
    <unitid>C0841</unitid>
    <unitdate datechar="creation" normal="1858/2012" type="inclusive">1858-2012</unitdate>
    <unitdate datechar="creation" normal="1965/1995" type="bulk">1965-1995</unitdate>

```
yup, you can get it from archdesc/did/unitdate.
It looks like we generate the title from the unitdate/unittitle, so if you have some example records as well as what you want the title to be we can make it happen.
Well now I'm wondering if it should remain as is for now since that's how it's displayed on pulfa. Maybe the date info could be a smaller font similar to how it appears on pulfa?
@sdellis Thoughts? I'm not sure what the accessibility implications are there.
